Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured, possibly Komast group, pottery chalice; cream slip; interior glazed black (fired reddish) with traces of added red and added white bands; exterior, from top: black-figure decoration consisting of undetermined motif with red blob; part of possible komast's foot; incised rosette with red centre; band of zigzags above undetermined motif with dot rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1290) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
